alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Eastern Louisa; Fluvanna; Goochland; Powhatan; Western Louisa (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Louisa, northeastern Cumberland, Goochland, northwestern Powhatan and Fluvanna Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 215 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Kents Store to near Fork Union to 6 miles northeast of Centenary. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, torrential rainfall, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Goochland, Hadensville, Palmyra, Cartersville, Fork Union, Columbia, Gum Spring, Oilville, Ferncliff, Trenholm, Lakeside Village, Kents Store, Fife, Duncan, Scottsville, Orchid, Maidens, Three Square, Central Plains and Bremo Bluff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Cumberland; Eastern Louisa; Fluvanna; Goochland; Powhatan; Western Louisa
